meanings.definition: To revoke or annul (a law or act)
meanings.sent1: The city council repealed the outdated parking regulation.
meanings.sent2: The judge repealed the unfair ruling.
meanings.sent3: The students jokingly tried to get the teacher to repeal the homework assignment.
meanings.sent4: The new evidence was so compelling that it practically repealed the previous verdict.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to repeal the laws of physics, creating a mesmerizing illusion.

meanings.definition: To rescind or cancel (a decision or rule)
meanings.sent1: The company repealed the policy on casual Fridays.
meanings.sent2: The principal repealed the ban on cell phones in school.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully tried to repeal the 'no pets on the couch' rule.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so infectious, it seemed to repeal any negative thoughts in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streaming through the window seemed to repeal the darkness of the room, bringing warmth and light.
